snippet: New guidance is intended to rein in practices like firms underwriting a state’s bonds while simultaneously helping other customers trade against the bonds.
abstract: Federal regulators release new rules for the brokerage firms that help cities and states raise billions of dollars by issuing bonds every year; new regulations are intended to prevent debt disasters and rein in Wall Street practices that exploit smaller bond markets.
lead_paragraph: New guidance is intended to rein in practices like firms underwriting a state’s bonds while simultaneously helping other customers trade against the bonds.

headline.main: Rules Tightened on Municipal Bond Deals
headline.print_headline: Tighter Rules Are Issued On Municipal Bond Deals

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
